ai_summary: This commit modifies the documentation for Lifecycle Workflows, specifically focusing on the "Remove all access package assignments for user" task. The changes include updating the `ms.date` to August 29, 2025 and refining the instructions on assigning roles with administrative unit scopes, specifically mentioning limitations when using the "Roles & admins" page and providing a link to the correct method for assigning custom roles with administrative unit scope.

author: James Barnett
message:
Merge pull request #9533 from OWinfreyATL/owinfreyATL-AccessPackageAssignmentBehavior-PublicPreview

Assignment package workflow Public Preview
ai_summary: This commit updates the documentation for lifecycle workflow tasks, specifically focusing on the "Remove all access package assignments for user" task. The changes include: clarifying that the task allows customization of name, description, and the delay before assignments are removed; adding details about the "daysUntilExpiration" argument in the Microsoft Graph parameters, along with a code example; and the commit also touches up a media file.

author: Ortagus Winfrey
ai_summary: This commit modifies the `docs/id-governance/lifecycle-workflow-tasks.md` file. It adds a new argument definition to the "Remove all access package assignments for user" task, specifying a "daysUntilExpiration" parameter. This parameter allows users to customize the expiration of access package assignments within the workflow.

author: Ortagus Winfrey
ai_summary: This commit introduces a change to the documentation for lifecycle workflows in Microsoft Entra ID. The primary update focuses on the "Remove all access package assignments for user" task, specifying that users can now customize the task name, description, and the delay before assignments are removed. Additionally, the commit includes a corresponding update to the documentation's example Microsoft Graph usage and an updated image related to the task.

author: learn-build-service-prod[bot]
message:
Merge pull request #9531 from MicrosoftDocs/main

Auto Publish – main to live - 2025-08-29 17:04 UTC
ai_summary: This commit updates documentation across several Microsoft Entra ID-related areas. Key changes include:  updates to the documentation for Certificate Revocation List (CRL) in certificate-based authentication, including a new dedicated article and updates to existing articles; adjustments to content related to Privileged Identity Management (PIM) audit logs; and various other content and link updates.  There are also changes to what's new, as well as some code cleanup/format changes across several documents.

author: James Barnett
message:
Merge pull request #9329 from vimrang/CRLChanges

creating new CRL page
ai_summary: This commit introduces significant changes to the Microsoft Entra documentation related to certificate-based authentication (CBA). Key updates include a new article dedicated to understanding Certificate Revocation Lists (CRLs), comprehensive revisions to existing articles to reflect the new CRL-related content, and updates to the table of contents to reflect the new content. These changes enhance the documentation around certificate revocation, CRL validation, and related error handling, improving the overall understanding of CBA configuration and security.

author: vimrang
ai_summary: This commit modifies the documentation related to certificate revocation lists (CRLs) for certificate-based authentication in Microsoft Entra ID. The changes involve a minor update to the "CRL error reference" section, likely fixing a typo in the header. The content of the "CRL error reference" is updated.

author: v-ccolin
message:
Merge pull request #9495 from barclayn/2025-august-pim-log-history

updating date
ai_summary: This commit updates the documentation on how to use the audit logs within Microsoft Entra Privileged Identity Management (PIM). It introduces two new images to the documentation, "my-audit.png" and "resource-audit.png", and modifies the "pim-how-to-use-audit-log.md" file to reflect the changes. The update clarifies how to view audit history for both resource and personal role activity, and streamlines the steps to access the information.

ai_summary: This commit modifies the "how-to-connect-install-prerequisites.md" file within the Microsoft Entra documentation. The changes include updating the "ms.date" to August 28, 2025, and adjusting the link for SQL Server TLS 1.2 support. Additionally, it updates the SQL Server versions listed for components installed during a basic Express installation of Microsoft Entra Connect, changing them from 2022 to 2019.
